Dalsace House
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Chareau, Pierre (French architect, 1883-1950) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Dalsaces asked Chareau to design a house in Paris that would be placed within the first three floors of an eighteenth-century building. The glass block facade enclosed both a ground-floor medical suite for Dr. Jean Dalsace and an apartment. -- Macmillan Encyclopedia of Architects (1980) and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maison_de_Verre [work]
